noun.description: A set of circumstances in which one finds oneself; a state of affairs.
examples: the situation between her and Jake had come to a head

noun.description: The location and surroundings of a place.
examples: the situation of the town is pleasant

noun.description: A position of employment; a job.

origin: Late Middle English (in situation (sense 2)): from French, or from medieval Latin situatio(n-), from situare to place (see situate). Sense 1 dates from the early 18th century.
